content: 1 Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon our beloved and fellow-worker,
content_old: 1 Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon our beloved and fellow-worker,

content: 2 and to Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow-soldier, and to the church in thy house:
content_old: 2 and to Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow-soldier, and to the church in thy house:

content: 3 Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 3 Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 4 I thank my God always, making mention of thee in my prayers,
content_old: 4 I thank my God always, making mention of thee in my prayers,

content: 5 hearing of thy love, and of the faith which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all the saints;
content_old: 5 hearing of thy love, and of the faith which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all the saints;

content: 6 that the fellowship of thy faith may become effectual, in the knowledge of every good thing which is in you, unto Christ.
content_old: 6 that the fellowship of thy faith may become effectual, in the knowledge of every good thing which is in you, unto Christ.

content: 7 For I had much joy and comfort in thy love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through thee, brother.
content_old: 7 For I had much joy and comfort in thy love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through thee, brother.

content: 8 Wherefore, though I have all boldness in Christ to enjoin thee that which is befitting,
content_old: 8 Wherefore, though I have all boldness in Christ to enjoin thee that which is befitting,

content: 9 yet for love’s sake I rather beseech, being such a one as Paul the aged, and now a prisoner also of Christ Jesus:
content_old: 9 yet for love’s sake I rather beseech, being such a one as Paul the aged, and now a prisoner also of Christ Jesus:

content: 10 I beseech thee for my child, whom I have begotten in my bonds, Onesimus,
content_old: 10 I beseech thee for my child, whom I have begotten in my bonds, Onesimus,

content: 11 who once was unprofitable to thee, but now is profitable to thee and to me:
content_old: 11 who once was unprofitable to thee, but now is profitable to thee and to me:

content: 12 whom I have sent back to thee in his own person, that is, my very heart:
content_old: 12 whom I have sent back to thee in his own person, that is, my very heart:

content: 13 whom I would fain have kept with me, that in thy behalf he might minister unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
content_old: 13 whom I would fain have kept with me, that in thy behalf he might minister unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

content: 14 but without thy mind I would do nothing; that thy goodness should not be as of necessity, but of free will.
content_old: 14 but without thy mind I would do nothing; that thy goodness should not be as of necessity, but of free will.

content: 15 For perhaps he was therefore parted from thee for a season, that thou shouldest have him for ever;
content_old: 15 For perhaps he was therefore parted from thee for a season, that thou shouldest have him for ever;

content: 16 no longer as a servant, but more than a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much rather to thee, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
content_old: 16 no longer as a servant, but more than a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much rather to thee, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

content: 17 If then thou countest me a partner, receive him as myself.
content_old: 17 If then thou countest me a partner, receive him as myself.

content: 18 But if he hath wronged thee at all, or oweth thee aught, put that to mine account;
content_old: 18 But if he hath wronged thee at all, or oweth thee aught, put that to mine account;

content: 19 I Paul write it with mine own hand, I will repay it: that I say not unto thee that thou owest to me even thine own self besides.
content_old: 19 I Paul write it with mine own hand, I will repay it: that I say not unto thee that thou owest to me even thine own self besides.

content: 20 Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my heart in Christ.
content_old: 20 Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my heart in Christ.

content: 21 Having confidence in thine obedience I write unto thee, knowing that thou wilt do even beyond what I say.
content_old: 21 Having confidence in thine obedience I write unto thee, knowing that thou wilt do even beyond what I say.

content: 22 But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I hope that through your prayers I shall be granted unto you.
content_old: 22 But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I hope that through your prayers I shall be granted unto you.

content: 23 Epaphras, my fellow-prisoner in Christ Jesus, saluteth thee;
content_old: 23 Epaphras, my fellow-prisoner in Christ Jesus, saluteth thee;

content: 24 and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my fellow-workers.
content_old: 24 and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my fellow-workers.
